name: EKS Clusters
deleteTips: Are you sure you want to remove the imported EKS Cluster

eksSource.eksClusterDesc: Select an existing EKS cluster from
eksSource.eksAgentPatternDesc: Please choose the collection mode which will be used to deploy logging agent.
eksSource.networkConfigDesc: If you plan to ingest EKS logs to OpenSearch directly (i.e., without using Amazon S3 or Kinesis Data Streams as buffer layer), please make sure the VPC of your EKS cluster and the VPC of OpenSearch are connected. If they are not connected, you can follow the below steps to create VPC peering. (Note, VPC peering will incur additional cost).
eksSource.vpc1: 1. Create and accept VPC peering follow
eksSource.acknowledge: Please acknowledge the checkbox before proceeding.
eksSource.confirmed: I acknowledge the VPC connectivity requirement to ingest log from EKS to OpenSearch directly.

ingestions.deleteTips: Are you sure you want to delete the log log source(s)? Note: the App Log Pipeline will not be deleted.

daemonsetGuide.alertDesc: Please ensure that all log source(s) you have created are in the Created state before proceeding with the following steps. All steps in this procedure are to deploy Fluent Bit agent as a DaemonSet. By default, the namespace "logging" is used
daemonsetGuide.step1: You will need to copy and paste all the content below in a file ~/fluent-bit-logging.yaml
daemonsetGuide.step2: Use the kubectl command to deploy fluent-bit as DaemonSet.
daemonsetGuide.createIngestion: Please create an log source first

specifyPipeline.alert: The pipeline you are creating or choosing form are connected with Amazon OpenSearch domain:
specifyPipeline.createNewDesc: Create a new Application Log Pipeline
specifyPipeline.indexPrefixDesc: Enter the index of the log saved in OpenSearch

sidecarTab.alert: You will need to deploy Fluent Bit agent as a sidecar in your pod and please ensure that all log source(s) you have created are in the Created state before proceeding.

daemonsetTab.alert: For DaemonSet pattern. All log source(s) share the same deployment guide. Please find it at
